name: WH Rio Poty Sao Luis Hotel

reviews.text: This place gets some very mixed reviews, and I guess that is right: it has some good features and some bad ones - it depends which ones hit you the most. Essentially, it seems to be a hotel that originally had good intentions but is now struggling in several areas. It needs some new investment and attention to details.
reviews.title: Comfortable but annoying

reviews.text: We stayed four nights at a conference (in the hotel). Our room was large and clean and reasonably comfortable, with a large Kingsize bed with linen changed every day. On the downside, we had no balcony (most rooms do) just a small window (this a result of stupid architectural external facade design); but that did mean that we had the extra space within the room. It's the details that let it down - e.g. no hairdryer in the room (but available), just 3 hangers in the wardrobe, the in-room safe disabled by removal of the lock, the room door electronic card lock intermittently failing to work. But the mini-bar worked and kept our wine and water nicely chilled. The bathroom was OK, but again failing on details - e.g. cheap plastic broken lavatory seat, dripping tap, occasional brown bath/shower water (just let it run for a while).
reviews.title: Terrible!

reviews.text: Outside, the hotel has plenty of outdoor terrace space - but very limited seating in order to enjoy it. The pool is large and looks nice (we didn't try it, but colleagues - especially with children - did, and reported it OK) and has very nice landcaping around it, on a terrace overlooking (but not accessing) the beach. It could also do with more seating - and lots more good shade, given that it's almost on the equator and scorching! There is also a gym.
reviews.title: Other than XYZ, this hotel was great(!)

reviews.text: The hotel has a modest bar and restaurant. Breakfast was good. Just a few staff speak a little English.
reviews.title: December 2011

reviews.text: Location is rather remote, out-of-town (10 minute taxi, only about R$10) on beach-strip development now including other hotels and some swanky-looking apartments. Nearby, walking towards town, are a few small cafe/bars and a pharmacy; also nearby, away from town direction, is a small but good supermarket 'Emporio'. In the historic Centro is a very good and very reasonably priced Restaurante SENAC, just of Praca Dom Pedro II, run as part of a culinary school.
reviews.title: Comfortable and good service

aka: WH Rio Poty Sao Luis Hotel Maranhao, Brazil
